summary.text: This class manages the GLConfig stack.
The position in the stack of the last "commit"
The current position in the stack
The list of the bitmask set of all the configs in the stack
The allocated size of the stack

The values of the configs at each position in the stack.
The stack is a 2d array where each row is a config.
The position in the stack of the last "commit"
Grow the allocated size of stack.
Copy the current stack state to the given patch config and mark HEAD as the current position.

Copy a row in the stack to the given config.

This will copy the row from
The position in the stack to copy from
Remove all configs from the stack.

Setup initial config from to match the config the
given webgl context is currently in, and set the
first config of the stack to this config.

Remove the last config from the stack.

If the HEAD position is ahead of the current position in the stack,
the current position config set is unioned with the removed config set.

Add a config to the stack.

The input config is applied to the previous config in the stack,
and the resulting config is added to the stack.

content.text: If the previous config in the stack is:

```js
[A, B, C, D, E, F, G] // previous row in _stack
[1, 0, 0, 1, 1, 1, 0] // previous row in _sets
```
Then the new config in the stack is:

```js
[A, B, X, D, E, F, G] // new row in _stack
[1, 0, 1, 1, 1, 1, 0] // new row in _sets
```

summary.text: The config to add to the stack
The bitmask for each config set.
The slot number for each config data.
This class manages configs for the webgl context.
The values of the config. Each value is stored in a specific slot of the array.
The bitmask set of the config. It indicates which values are set.

Set blending color for this config.

The params values should be floats between
The value for the red component
The value for the green component
The value for the blue component
The value for the alpha component

Set the blending equation for this config.

The possible params values are :
-

Set the blending equation for RGB and alpha components separately for this config.

The possible params values are :
-
The equation to use for the RGB components
The equation to use for the alpha component

Set the blending function for this config.

The possible params values are :
-
The multiplier for the source blending factors
The multiplier for the destination blending factors

Set the blending function for RGB and alpha components separately for this config.

The possible params values are :
-
The multiplier for the RGB source blending factors
The multiplier for the RGB destination blending factors
The multiplier for the alpha source blending factor
The multiplier for the alpha destination blending factor
Returns a clone of this config.

Set the line width of rasterized lines for this config.

Apply this config to the input config.

It creates a new config that represents the difference
between the input config and this config.
If applied to a webgl context matching the input config,
the webgl context will now match this config.
The input config to apply this config to
The config to store the difference config in
Set the polygon offset factor & units for this config.
The scale factor for the variable depth offset for each polygon
The multiplier by which an implementation-specific value is multiplied with to create a constant depth offset

Set the stencil function for this config.

The possible func values are :
-
The stencil test function to use
The reference value for the stencil test
the reference value and the stored stencil value when the test is done

Set the stencil function separatly for the front and back stencil for this config.

The possible func values are :
-
The stencil test function to use for the front stencil
The reference value for the front stencil test
the reference value and the stored stencil value when the test is done for the front stencil
The stencil test function to use for the back stencil
The reference value for the back stencil test
the reference value and the stored stencil value when the test is done for the back stencil
Set the stencil mask for this config.
The bit mask to enable or disable writing in the stencil planes
Set the stencil mask separatly for the front and back stencil for this config.
The bit mask to enable or disable writing in the stencil planes for the front stencil
The bit mask to enable or disable writing in the stencil planes for the back stencil

Set the stencil test actions for this config.

The possible params values are :
-
The function to use when the stencil test fails
The function to use when the stencil test passes, but the depth test fails
The function to use when both the stencil test and the depth test pass

Set the stencil test actions separatly for the front and back stencil for this config.

The possible params values are :
-
The function to use when the front stencil test fails
The function to use when the front stencil test passes, but the depth test fails
The function to use when both the front stencil test and the depth test pass
The function to use when the back stencil test fails
The function to use when the back stencil test passes, but the depth test fails
The function to use when both the back stencil test and the depth test pass
Set this config to the default config.
Set the viewport for this config.
The x coordinate of the lower left corner of the viewport origin
The y coordinate of the lower left corner of the viewport origin

This class manages the webgl state.

It is used to manage a stack of GLConfigs and apply the current state to the webgl context.
The webgl context this GLState belongs to
Whether the config stack has been changed or not
The config stack managing all GLConfigs
The webgl context this GLState belongs to
The list of every GLState instance created, indexed by the corresponding webgl context
Apply the current stack state to the webgl context.
Create a LocalConfig from this GLState.

Apply a config to the webgl context immediatly,
without keeping it in the stack.
Remove the last config from the stack.
Push a config to the stack.
Create a GLState instance or return the existing one for given webgl context.

This class manages local configs.

It can be used for configs that will be applied directly,
and not pushed to the stack.
